name: DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Melbourne Beach Oceanfront

reviews.text: Actually only found ONE bed bug in the bathroom. Though I have a hard time believing where there's one bed bug, there isn't 100s or 1000s more. I let the front desk know and took a picture of it. I plan on writing the hotel chain and the hotel itself. We didn't get bit but I've been told that doesn't mean anything. When I got home I immediately put all the clothes in the dryer and then washed them. I left all the suitcases and other bags in black trash bags and left them on the deck in the heat. I'll leave them there for at least a week and then I may still not bring them into the house.
reviews.title: Basic hotel on the beach, but found bed bugs

reviews.text: The hotel itself was okay. Very average. The best thing about it, is that it's on the beach and all rooms face the beach. The front of the suite faces the street and the "back" faces the beach. The carpet was old and pretty much everything else was dated except they did have 2 flat screen TVs. One each in the bedroom and living area.
reviews.title: The view is AWESOME!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If it weren't for the bed bug, I'd say, "would definitely stay here again", but I'm not sure now. Plus the hotel isn't all that clean. Housekeeping did a pretty poor job cleaning the rooms. If you go, check for bed bugs. Check the matteress ALL the way around. I'm hoping I didn't bring any home.
reviews.title: Inappropriate front desk management and no response when Hilton contacted

reviews.text: Lastly, unless you're a priority member or whatever, it doesn't come with breakfast. They did give me "coupons" in the form of pieces of paper that allow two people to eat for $15 and a third to eat for $8. For that kind of money, just go to Blueberry Muffin 2 blocks down and eat a $6 breakfast. I'm sure much better than limp hotel buffet bacon!
reviews.title: Not bad Not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're looking for a clean, comfortable place to relax at the beach, this place is it. It is very family friendly and contrary to some of the other reviews I have read, we found the food at the restaurant to be excellent. We were considering this hotel or staying in Cocoa but settled on this hotel based on the fact that all the rooms have balconies facing the ocean. Worth the drive down the coast. The beach was never crowded even on the weekend and the staff was very friendly. And you can't beat the DoubleTree cookie! Will definately stay here again.
reviews.title: Too many Roaches

reviews.text: What a nice surprise! We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel--the front desk and staff were all very helpful and friendly. The rooms were clean, spacious and had great views from the oceanfront balconies. The pool and whirlpool were well kept and enjoyed by all--close access to beach with beach service. The laudromat was clean and easy to use. The warm, fresh cookies available any time were a nice touch! Unfortunately the restaurant was really slow---the food was good just took a really long time to get it! Don't go there if you are really hungry. The neighboring restaurant Squid's Lips was wonderful--nice menu with open air on the waterfront. Also enjoyed the Eco SUP trip (stand up paddleboarding). Was great to watch for the sea turtles as they came to shore to lay thier eggs. Keep in mind this beach is kept in its natural state which means it has a lot of seaweed-fortunately NO jellyfish when we were there!
reviews.title: Wish we could have stayed longer

reviews.text: After booking months earlier for Memorial day weekend, we get a call at 5:00 p.m. the day of our reservation that there had been a problem with our room and the hotel booked us at another area hotel which was absolutely not acceptable. After confronting the desk and demanding to see this "damaged" hotel room, they found us a room. Never have had this happen before and we travel a lot. I will never stay at another Doubletree.
reviews.title: overbooked and tried to dump our reservation

reviews.text: We booked a two room suite with two queen beds and a living room. The room was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great stay if you like the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were given vouchers for a couple of breakfasts and drinks at the bar. We were visiting friends and didn't make it back to the hotel before 11pm. By that time, the bar was already closed so if you are planning to book a room and hang out at the bar instead of going out, it won't be a late night. One of our friends met us for breakfast and the price for what you get is ridiculous if you're paying. The fruit was good but that was the only thing on the breakfast buffet that was worth paying for. We didn't use the vouchers the next morning and, instead, went to get breakfast elsewhere. And, because breakfast was so disappointing, we didn't bother eating any other meals at the hotel restaurant. However, the front desk frequently had homemade cookies and those were very nice.
reviews.title: Great hotel stay

reviews.text: The pool area was very nice and there was a nice view of the pool and tiki bar from the hotel lobby. The rooms are outside access rooms but we had to use a key card to access the hallway leading to them once we got off the elevator so it wasn't as insecure as outside rooms frequently are. The ocean view is beautiful and, in the evenings, there are few lights on up and down the beach to keep the sea turtles from being drawn to the lights so the beach view is dark but relatively unobstructed. The hotel provides a request in the room to keep curtains drawn if the lights are on.
reviews.title: Love This Hotel!

reviews.text: This is an older hotel but well kept right on the beach. Nice touches like freshly baked cookies, newer single coffee makers with to go cups, and a mp3 player plug in on the clock radio made it more special. Balcony overlooking the ocean, and separate small living room, granite countertops, small bathroom. This was definately worth what we paid.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fun bar down the street (bikes out front). No worries though - friendly people and live blues music. Also, check out art crawl on the town nearby. Fun!
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.text: Nice front desk staff, love the cookies on check-in! 2 room suite is very large and decorated with a bright beach theme. Mini refrigerator, microwave and large flatscreen TV in the living room. Bedroom has comfortable bed with nice, high-quality linens, along with another big flatscreen tv. Every room has a balcony (except for the bottom floor) and opens out to a magnificent view of the beach and ocean. Buffet breakfast in the restaurant was included in our rate and it was good - basic.. This is our 4th stay here visiting family and we will definitely be back!
reviews.title: Great Location, Suites with Cross-Breeze Fresh Air !

reviews.text: We have been here a few times already, simply because it is the most affordable suite room (door separation) on the beach. We need separate rooms because I snore, and this does the trick. Not only that but the best part about this hotel is the fact that there's a "cross breeze". Yes that means you have windows that can open on both sides of the room! That is extremely hard to find these days. So being on the beach many times we just turn off the A/C and enjoy the breeze and hear the ocean! Downfalls...well the bathroom/toilet area is small and tight to get in behind the door. Can't think of any other problems. Pool and restaurant/bar is right on the beach, small but convenient. Main bed is a dream, nice little balcony with a full view of the ocean. This is NOT an upscale hotel...but it has unique qualities.
reviews.title: Great hotel at great beach

reviews.text: We stayed here two days ago for one night (wish we stayed longer).
reviews.title: If you have a choice...stay away.

reviews.text: Could and should be cleaner. Exterior doors, no pool towels
reviews.title: Budget hotel with a mediocre refurbish

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Property was formerly a Best Western previous to Hurricane Andrew. Can not compare with the level of service and amenities available at the Crowne Plaza. Fiance' had no sleep the first three nights due to noisy neighbors. Room was a two room suite that sleeps four; however, they were very stingy with the towels leaving only 3 for 4 people. Breakfast was very poor; hash browns that looked like they were taken from the freezer and thawed in a microwave, slimy eggs, greasy bacon and sausage. Food temperature was very poor. Restock of items such as toilet paper and tissues was poor. The only good thing about this experience was the private oceanfront balcony.
reviews.title: Very Bad Experience

reviews.text: I stayed here with my 2 teenagers and a friend. The room worked out great, since it is set up like an Embassy room - living room with a pullout sofa, bathroom divider, and 2 double beds in the bedroom. The bathroom/shower were a little tight. The room included a mini fridge and a microwave - perfect for me, since I eat gluten free. The room has a perfect view of the expansive beach, and you can watch the sunrise from your own private balcony. The pool is nice, and they had live music on Saturday. Food and drink are available poolside. The beach is great for walking and calm enough to play in. Best value for the money that's oceanfront!!! We will definitely return.
reviews.title: Perfect Beach Destination!

reviews.text: We stayed one night at the Doubletree Guest Suites to watch the Space Shuttle Launch (which was amazing!). Long time Hilton Honors member and am used to the Doubletree properties being a step above but this location needs some work. The first issue we encountered, which was NOT the fault of the hotel, was the infestation of the Lovebugs. There were thousands of them everywhere! In the lobby, smashed on the floors, smashed on the walls, by the elevators...don't even think about going out by the pool or enjoying a cocktail outside. We had reserved an oceanview room with balcony and couldn't even open our door to the balcony because there were hundreds of bugs out there (we were on the 5th floor). This hotel has outside room entrances and whenever we wanted to leave our room, it was a mad dash out the door, into the lobby (and more bugs) then a mad dash out to our car. Also ran out the lobby, down the stairs and to the beach where the bugs weren't so bad...at least we got a bit of fresh ocean air.
reviews.title: Needs Some Maintenance

reviews.text: Since we couldn't spend any time outside, we decided to go online with the laptop and get a little work done. This hotel does not have wireless in the rooms, not even for a fee, which is amazing to me in this day and age. I plugged my laptop into the ethernet cable and no connection. The instructions in the room give a tech support number to call so I did that. After spending 15 minutes on the phone with a technician, he determined that the cable must be bad. I ran down (thru the bugs) to the front desk in hopes of picking up a new ethernet cable. No such luck. I was informed that maintenance would try to find another one but no promises. About 40 minutes later we were given a new cable but this one didn't work either. So no internet at all except in the business center in the lobby where wireless was available but I paid for a room and would rather be in it, possibly having a cocktail and watching a little TV while I work, than in a business center.
reviews.title: We were pleasantly surprised

aka: Doubletree Guest Suites Melbourne Beach Oceanfront Hotel
description: The DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Melbourne Beach Oceanfront boasts a resort-style setting overlooking white sand of the Atlantic Ocean. Our Melbourne Beach hotel is conveniently located near Cocoa Beach and Space Coast attractions, with nearby family attractions such as Disney World and other Orlando theme parks for day trips. Our all-suite Melbourne, FL hotel is only 10 minutes from Melbourne International Airport (MLB), or an hour east of Orlando International (MCO). The DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Melbourne Beach Oceanfront features direct oceanfront suites, perfect for business or leisure visitors alike. Guests can enjoy magnificent views from private balconies, and a range of must-have amenities including luxurious beds and bath amenities, and access to our 24-Hour Fitness Center and Business Center. Whether you are traveling on business, planning a family vacation, or having a romantic weekend getaway, our friendly, professional staff looks forward to welcoming you to Florida's Space Coast with our special, warm chocolate chip cookie at check-in. We hope you choose the DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Melbourne Beach Oceanfront hotel!
